definition: to change (appearance)/to change shape
to change/to become different/to transform/to vary/rebellion
manner/pattern/way/appearance/shape/classifier: kind, type
erhua variant of 變樣|变样[bian4 yang4]

sentences.english: Ah, what a difference a homegrown financial crisis makes.
sentences.chinese: 啊，一场国产的金融危机令一切大变样。

sentences.english: I've been to China years ago and it has changed out of all recognition.
sentences.chinese: 几年前我去过中国，中国已经大变样了。

sentences.english: Static compression can induce degenerative-like changes in the intervertebral disc.
sentences.chinese: 静态压力可以对椎间盘造成退变样改变。

sentences.english: Each spring, after he shaved it, he looked so different from before.
sentences.chinese: 等到春天，他一刮了脸，人就大变样了。

sentences.english: But sometimes down through the years, the name was changed.
sentences.chinese: 但是有时候长期流传下来的名字会变样。

sentences.english: How times have changed since then.
sentences.chinese: 时光飞逝，十里洋场已经大变样儿了。

sentences.english: Now they all know (the fact) that China has been greatly changed.
sentences.chinese: 现在他们都知道中国大变样这个事实。

sentences.english: One honest man can make a difference.
sentences.chinese: 有一个老实人就可以大变样。
这样，每个季节，你会感觉到自己变样了。

sentences.english: You will be surprised at how quickly the world around you will change.
sentences.chinese: 你会惊讶地发现你周围的世界会马上变样。

sentences.english: One honest man can make a difference .
sentences.chinese: 有一个老实人就可以大变样。
有一个老实人就可以大变样。

sentences.english: If one day, thanks to universe, We just love forever in the world.
sentences.chinese: 如果有一天宇宙都变样，我们只求爱永在世上。

sentences.english: After years of eating excessively.he was terribly out of shape.
sentences.chinese: 长年吃得过多之后，他的身体极度地变样。

definition: to lose shape/to deform
same as 一樣|一样[yi1 yang4]/the same
to disfigure
lit. a girl changes eighteen times between childhood and womanhood (idiom)/fig. a young woman is very different from the little girl she once was
to change from day to day
to look completely new (idiom); brand new/changed beyond recognition
to change/to become different/to transform/to vary/rebellion
out of shape/to lose shape/to deform
old situation/things as they were
to put on weight/to get fat (a sign of prosperity, so a compliment)
look/style/appearance/approximation/about/CL:個|个[ge4]/also pr. [mo2 yang4]
unsophisticated/rustic/uncouth
stupefied/stunned
to be dead/not to be, or cease to exist
to look old
in a wink
